Posts.EditableText:
Chat rooms are better with larger communities. Most times I'm logged onto the forum I'm the only one on there. I imagine the chat would be pretty much the same and it's not my idea of a fun time logging in then sitting around for hours waiting for someone else to log in.

Maybe when the Quest community grows over the next few years a chat room would be a good idea.

Posts.EditableText:
Chat room?

Who are you expecting to chat to? Whenever people ARE here its not in groups of 10 - it's more like 2-3 at most... If you want to chat then e-mail or get contact details from us and then go that way.

Posts.EditableText:
If it would appease everybody, I could use this opportunity to test out my hosting(500mb, 5g monthly transfer) and set up a chat program on it. People seem like they'd want something completely browser based, but I may be able to find something with a small client side aspect to it so we can all just sit afk in the room and conversation can spark when 1 or more people has time and is up to it.

Eh, I'll look around, but I'm back on dial up([b:1hygs4pg]"AOL 9.0 OPTIMIZED!" <--BLOW ME[/b:1hygs4pg]) so the looking will be slow.
